title: How to Turn VoiceOver Off on Your iPhone: The Ultimate Guide

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. You can also disable VoiceOver using the Settings app (the gear icon) on your Home screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accessibility once to select it, then double-tap it to open it.
steps.content: Tap Accessibility once to select it, then double-tap it to open it. It's near the top of the screen, under the General menu option. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap VoiceOver once to select it, then double-tap it to open it.
steps.content: Tap VoiceOver once to select it, then double-tap it to open it. This option is at the top of the "Accessibility" page. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap VoiceOver once to select it, then double-tap it to toggle it off.
steps.content: Tap VoiceOver once to select it, then double-tap it to toggle it off. You will hear the message "VoiceOver off" and regular control will be returned to your iPhone. [4] X Research source To toggle VoiceOver back on, simply tap VoiceOver to do so. The toggle will turn green when VoiceOver is on.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Control Center.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Control Center. If you've added VoiceOver to the Control Center, you can disable the feature there easily. To open Control Center with VoiceOver on, swipe down from the top-right corner of the screen [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Accessibility icon once to select it, then double-tap to open.
steps.content: Tap the Accessibility icon once to select it, then double-tap to open. It's the round icon with a person inside.

steps.title: Tap VoiceOver once to select it, then double-tap to disable.
steps.content: Tap VoiceOver once to select it, then double-tap to disable. This instantly disables VoiceOver.

steps.title: Activate Siri
steps.content: Activate Siri . You can activate Siri by pressing and holding the Home button (if your phone has a Home button) or by pressing and holding the side button (on phones without a Home button). If Siri is voice-activated, you can also say "Hey Siri." [6] X Research source

steps.title: Say "Turn off VoiceOver."
steps.content: Say "Turn off VoiceOver." You may have to wait a moment for Siri to process your command. When Siri says "OK, I turned off VoiceOver,‚Äù the feature will turn off. To turn VoiceOver back on, activate Siri again and say "Turn on VoiceOver."
